message: I'm offering you a unique opportunity to buy a product for $100. I'm not sure what you think of it, but I'm willing to give you a hint: if you buy it, you'll have the chance to buy another product in the next round. If you don't buy it, I'll just take it home and you'll never see it again.
I'll take the chance since the potential gain is $200 ($300 - $100) and there's a 50% chance it's high quality.

You just bought a product that turned out to be low-quality. I'm glad you took the chance! This time, I'll give you a more direct message: I've already sold you a low-quality product, and I'm offering you another one. If you buy this one, you'll be buying two low-quality products in a row. If you don't buy it, I'll sell it to someone else, and you'll be left with only one low-quality product. The price remains the same, $100.
Given the last product was low-quality and there's still a 50% chance this one is low-quality, I won't take the risk this time.

If you buy it, I'll give you a full refund if the next product I offer is also high-quality. This way, you'll get a great product and a chance to get another one for free. The price remains $100, but I think you'll find it's a great value.
Since you're offering a high-quality product and a potential refund for the next round, the potential gain outweighs the risk.

Given the 'certified high-quality' guarantee and the potential refund if it's not worth at least $120, the risk is minimal. I'll take the deal, considering the product's potential worth of $300.
